And what?



Find me a legitimate peer-reviewed research on the negative effects of hairstyle appropriation and then I'll care.



Until then I'm gonna say this isn't a big deal.

It's hair, if someone wants to braid their hair I am not going to give em a side eye. It's up to them if they want to look bad if they cant rock em. It's hair, if someone wants to braid their hair I am not going to give em a side eye. It's up to them if they want to look bad if they cant rock em.

random, but i remember somebody asked me that (like yearsss ago) when that alaric guy from the vampire diaries was suddenly exposed as like a sexist libertarian type person (i don't even remember the specifics lol). i was like "sorry i wasn't psychic enough to predict he'd say this shit"



like, that's the whole point of "exposed", the fact you stop liking your former faves (or you start caping for them)

I absolutely HATE when celebrities come with the "let's focus on the more important things in the world" when they're getting dragged for something.



I followed her on Instagram/Twitter and she doesn't post anything other than photos of her daughter, photos of her dog, photos of her and her sister doing yoga, photos of her shoes/clothes. (Totally fine, of course. Her feed.)



Not once has she made a post showing that she's focusing on anything substantial going on in the world... but now she wants to all of us to forget her hair (and shoes and clothes and yoga) and go back to focusing on the important things (like the shoes and clothes and yoga she posts about.)
